alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:18AM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Peoria affecting Tazewell, Woodford and Peoria Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Henry affecting Putnam and Marshall Counties. Illinois River near Havana affecting Fulton, Cass and Mason Counties. Illinois River at Beardstown affecting Morgan, Brown, Schuyler and Cass Counties. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Ice is moving through the channel, which may result in fluctuations in the stage and future forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at Henry. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Water begins to affect the marina in Henry along with minor flooding of land adjacent to the river. At 28.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect buildings east of Illinois Route 29 in Sparland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Sunday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CST Sunday was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Illinois River Henry 23.0 24.3 Sun 9 am CST 25.1 25.6 26.0 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
